title: A Study of conflict in Sinclair Lewis's main street
abstract: Carol Kennicott is a sophisticated young woman who comes to a small town of Gopher Prairie after she was married.She dislikes the raw ugliness of Gopher Prairie which really contrast to the place where she comes from. This dislike makes Carol want to change Gopher Prairie to be an ideal city.But Carol's ideas cannot be realized there because she finds many obstacles.People of Gopher Prairie do not like any changing.And the opposite ideas of the two desires become the main conflict of the story. Then,Carol runs away from Gopher Prairie to find her real identity.Through several conflicts she becomes aware of her mistakes.Finally she goes back to Gopher Prairie because she realizes that Gopher Prairie is better than other places.
contributors: LUZ R. GADDI (Examination Committee 1); JENNY M. DJUNDJUNG (Advisor 1)
subjects: AMERICAN FICTION--20TH CENTURY--STUDY AND TEACHING; LEWIS, SINCLAIR, 1885-1951. MAIN STREET-STUDY AND TEACHING
